timeline.bodyText: I don't think you need to call toString() explicitly here (and in other similar places).
timeline.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText:
@mbasmanova Actually without the .toString() the compilation would fail. The add method takes Object not String specifically:
public ToStringHelper add(String name, @Nullable Object value)
replies.author: yingsu00

replies.bodyText: @yingsu00 I'm confused. Are you saying .add("super", super) fails to compile? What's the error? I expect this to work and call "super.toString()" internally.
replies.author: mbasmanova
yingsu00
